detected_issues.description: Excessive acetaminophen dosing in patient with Child-Pugh Class B cirrhosis - acute-on-chronic liver failure risk
detected_issues.reasoning: Patient with documented Child-Pugh Class B cirrhosis (bilirubin 2.8, albumin 2.9, INR 1.6, score 8) prescribed Acetaminophen 1000mg QID = 4,000 mg/day total. While 4g/day is standard maximum in healthy adults, patients with cirrhosis have impaired hepatic metabolism and increased susceptibility to acetaminophen hepatotoxicity. Maximum safe dose in cirrhotic patients is 2g/day (2,000 mg/day). Prescribed dose is double the safe maximum for this patient population. Risk of acute-on-chronic liver failure, which carries >50% mortality. Should prescribe maximum 500mg QID or 650mg TID (2g/day max), or consider alternative analgesic with minimal hepatic metabolism.
